summary: The document is a memorandum from J. Barry Harrelson, the JFK Project Officer, to several CIA officials concerning the agenda for the 17 November ARRB meeting. It addresses various CIA-related matters, including the reconsideration of the Warrenton, Va. location of the CIA Record Center, a proposal to move up the opening date of the Nosenko NBR material, the potential release of references to a CIA employee under state cover, the review of Cuban Revolutionary Council (CRC) financial records, and the handling of documents with extensive lists of names, crypts, and companies. The memorandum emphasizes the importance of timely responses and preparations for the meeting.
key_findings: Reconsideration of the release of Warrenton, Va. as the location of the CIA Record Center is on the agenda.
A proposal to advance the opening date of the Nosenko NBR material from 2017 to 2010 is under consideration, with ARRB staff advising against it.
Discussion on the proposed release of references to a CIA employee under state cover, with some Board members favoring disclosure.
Review of Cuban Revolutionary Council (CRC) financial records, with monthly summaries to be considered as Assassination Records (ARs) and the remainder as NBR.
Documents containing extensive lists of names, crypts, and companies are deemed marginal, potentially classified as NBR or subject to delayed processing.
